actions.text: Read second time and referred to Senate Committee on Finance.
Committee on Finance requested executive comment from OMB; Treasury Department; Health and Human Services Department.

official_title: A bill to amend Title 11 of the Social Security Act to eliminate Child's Insurance Benefits in the case of youth age 18 through 21 who attend postsecondary schools.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to provide for the payment of child's insurance benefits to an individual on the basis of student status only if such individual is a full-time elementary or secondary school student (currently student status includes being a full-time postsecondary school student).

titles.title: A bill to amend Title 11 of the Social Security Act to eliminate Child's Insurance Benefits in the case of youth age 18 through 21 who attend postsecondary schools.
